alert.note: Alert for Clay; Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 3:38AM CDT until further notice by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chambers, Clay, Coosa, Randolph and Tallapoosa. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alexander City, Lanett, Roanoke, Dadeville, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Lafayette, Stewartville, Stroud, Weogufka, La Fayette, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Wadley, Lakeview, Five Points, Goldville, Hillabee Creek and Northern Lake Martin.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
